channel.title: Easy Request
channel.description:
I just need something that does the following:
[code]if find color 10264736 at 907, 491 then click 860, 546 wait(4000) if find color 13408512 at 636, 373 then click 552, 425 wait(33000) if find color 13408512 at 674, 463 then click 674, 463
startover;[/code] Also if it if doesn't find what it needs to, just make it go through the sequence until it has a match :)
It just does that infinitely.
Thanks!

item.title: Easy Request
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

Try this.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////
//                                                  //
//  Dudeofthed Presents:                            //
//                      A Color clicker for xSignal //
//                                                  //
//  Was a request                                   //
//                                                  //
//////////////////////////////////////////////////////
{
 Instructions:
              1. Run the script.
              2. Press F9 to quit the script.

 PLEASE NOTE: I do not know if this works or not because i have
              hardly any knowledge of the FindColor function. If
              not working, please fix it.
              Thanks.
              
}

program New;
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}

procedure Pro1;
begin
if(FindColor(10264736,907,491)) then
ClickMouse(860,546,True);
Wait(4000)
end;

procedure Pro2;
begin
if(FindColor(13408512,636,373)) then
ClickMouse(552,425,True);
Wait(33000)
end;

procedure Pro3;
begin
if(FindColor(13408512,674,463)) then
ClickMouse(674,463,True);
end;

begin
 repeat
  Pro1;
  Pro2;
  Pro3;
 Until(IsFKeyDown(9))
end.

I already see you have a basic knowledge of scar. I’m not sure if this will work or not but i am pretty sure because it worked on my computer.

Why did you want to do this anyway?

Thanks,
Dudeofthed.

Read full topic

item.title: Easy Request
item.dc:creator: @xSignal xSignal
item.description:
@xSignal wrote:

I just need something that does the following:

[code]if find color 10264736 at 907, 491
then click 860, 546
wait(4000)
if find color 13408512 at 636, 373
then click 552, 425
wait(33000)
if find color 13408512 at 674, 463
then click 674, 463

startover;[/code]
Also if it if doesn’t find what it needs to, just make it go through the sequence until it has a match

It just does that infinitely.

Thanks!
